formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: P(A) = \(\dfrac{\text{number of favourable outcomes}}{\text{total number of possible outcomes}}\)

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Key rules for independent events P(A \cap B) = P(A) P(B) (“A and B”). P(A \cup B) = P(A) + P(B) − P(A) P(B) (“A or B”, inclusive). P(\text{exactly one}) = P(A \cup B) − P(A \cap B). P(A \cap B^c) = P(A) (1 − P(B)) (“A and not B”).

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: P(X = k) = \(\binom{n}{k} p^k (1 - p)^{n-k}\), where \(\binom{n}{k} = \dfrac{n!}{k!(n-k)!}\) is the binomial coefficient “n choose k”.
